SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE FOR SLACK INTEGRATIONS
Subscribe to CRM Analytics Dashboards in Slack

Schedule regular delivery of dashboard snapshots. When viewing a CRM Analytics dashboard in Slack, you can subscribe to it and specify the delivery schedule and Slack recipients. The subscription runs the dashboard at your scheduled times (in your org’s time zone) and delivers fresh snapshots to you and your selected recipients.

Create Subscriptions

IMPORTANT Before a subscription is delivered, a snapshot of the dashboard is generated. The snapshot is your view, with your default start values, saved view, and row level security predicates applied. If you send the subscription to teammates or channels, they get the snapshot of your personal view, including any confidential data.

To create a subscription to a dashboard:

Click the three dots next to the dashboard to open its action menu.
Select Subscribe.
Select the days, time, and if applicable, additional people or channels to receive the subscription.

Important: The hour options are Pacific Time. Convert to your time zone when selecting hours. For example, if you want your subscription to arrive at 10:00 AM Eastern Time, select 7:00 AM.

Specify whether to include a snapshot of the dashboard in the subscription post. If the dashboard has saved views, select the view to appear with the subscription. Note: Lightning Web Components within dashboards don't appear in snapshots posted in Slack.
Click Done.

If you included a snapshot with a subscription, your recipients have these options:

View and download as PDF (an accessible PDF is delivered in a thread on the subscription post)
Open the item in Salesforce
NOTE The limit on concurrent dashboard subscriptions, including subscriptions to multiple saved views of a single dashboard, is 10.

Edit Subscriptions

Subscriptions are automatically enabled when created. To disable a subscription or change its options:

On the Home tab, click View & Manage Subscriptions. Alternatively, enter the /analytics-crma-subscriptions command in the message field anywhere in Slack.
Next to the subscription you want to edit, open the menu and select Edit.
Update status, days, time, recipients, and snapshot options, as needed.
Click Done.

Delete Subscriptions

To delete a subscription to a dashboard:

On the Home tab, click View & Manage Subscriptions. Alternatively, enter the /analytics-crma-subscriptions command in the message field anywhere in Slack.
Next to the subscription you want to delete, open the menu and select Delete.
In the confirmation box, click Yes.
NOTE Deleting a subscription in the CRM Analytics for Slack app stops the subscription in Slack. It doesn’t affect your dashboards or subscriptions in CRM Analytics.
NOTE For limits on columns and pages in downloaded .pdf files, see Analytics Download Limits.
